title: Yemen: Protecting sheep and goats against disease

subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat
Grasp the steering wheel with both hands
Adjust the tractor speed using the throttle or gas pedal
Use foot pedals for transmission or implements
Align the cultivator attachments with the ground
Attach the cultivator to the tractor
Position the cultivator teeth or blades for proper soil disturbance
Control the depth of the cultivator into the soil
Start and stop the cultivator motor, if separate from the tractor
Make turns to adjust the direction of travel
Maintain a straight path using visual references or GPS
Adjust speed to navigate uneven terrain or obstacles
Navigate around scattered rocks, drainage ditches, or other field elements

tasks.task: Engage with the in-cab display system
subtasks: Locate the touchscreen or control panel
Navigate through menus to check settings or diagnose issues
Make adjustments or enter data into the system
Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, etc.)
Check tires for proper air pressure and wear
Lubricate moving parts or replace worn components
Perform basic electrical checks (lights, batteries)
